newsitem.title: INDIA: BADMINTON-ARBI LEADS INDONESIA TO CLEAN SWEEP.
newsitem.headline: BADMINTON-ARBI LEADS INDONESIA TO CLEAN SWEEP.

text.p: World champion Heryanto Arbi led an Indonesian sweep of the titles at the Indian Open Grand Prix on Sunday.
Third seed Arbi, playing in only his second tournament since the Atlanta Olympics following a calf muscle injury, cruised to a 15-4 15-7 victory over India's Pullela Gopichand in the men's final.
Arbi, who beat Olympic champion and top seed Poul Erik Hoyer-Larsen of Denmark in the semifinals, scored points at will with his flat cross-court smashes and pinpoint drop shots.
Afterwards he said he would be concentrating on preparing for the All-England championships and would not compete in next week's Asia Cup in Jakarta.
Top seed Cindana Hartono was also an emphatic winner of the women's title. She beat South Korean Lee Soon-deuk 11-6 11-7.
